Module kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem
Package kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem.controller.products

Class ProductsController

java.lang.Object
kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem.controller.products.ProductsController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddProductController, ModifyProductController
public abstract class ProductsController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Abstract controller class for the Products FXML view.
Author:
Timothy Albert Kline

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes select member variables and modifies form "title" label. Calls helper functions to initialize containers for various FXML fields. Injects formLabelTitle into productFormLBL. Initialize tables for available parts and the current product's associated parts.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - url
      resourceBundle - resource bundle
      See Also:
      • initTextFieldContainerSet()
      • initFeedbackTextsSet()
      • resetFeedbackTexts()
      • populateAssocPartsTbl()
      • DBTableController.initDBTblController(String, String, String, String, ObservableList)

    • handleCancelBtnEvent

      public void handleCancelBtnEvent(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles cancel button event. Calls static helper function returnToMenu.
      Parameters:
      event - action event.
      See Also:
      • SceneManager.returnToMenu(ActionEvent)

    • handleAddPartBtnEvent

      public void handleAddPartBtnEvent(javafx.event.ActionEvent ignoredEvent)
      Handles Add part button event. Attempts to add an item selected from the available parts table to the current product's list of associated parts. Displays a dialog window if no item was selected. Updates the TableView of the associated parts.
      Parameters:
      ignoredEvent - action event
      See Also:
      • DialogManager.displaySelectionError()
      • ProductBuilder.add(Part)

    • populateAssocPartsTbl

      protected void populateAssocPartsTbl()
      Wrapper function to update the items in the associated parts TableView

    • handleRmvPartBtnEvent

      public void handleRmvPartBtnEvent(javafx.event.ActionEvent ignoredEvent)
      Handles Remove associated part button event. Attempts to remove an item selected from the associated parts table from the current product's list of associated parts. Displays a dialog window to confirm removal. Notifies part was not removed if removal was cancelled. Displays a dialog window if no item was selected. Updates the TableView of the associated parts.
      Parameters:
      ignoredEvent - action event
      See Also:
      • DialogManager
      • ProductBuilder.delete(Part)

    • handleSaveBtnEvent

      public abstract void handleSaveBtnEvent(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws Exception
      Handles save event. Must call validateInput() to parse and check user inputs from FXML form.
      Parameters:
      event - button click. Used for redirecting to a new scene after saving.
      Throws:
      Exception - error log.
      See Also:
      • validateInputs()

    • createProduct

      protected Product createProduct()
      Creates a new Product using ProductBuilder.
      Returns:
      the new Part.
      See Also:
      • ProductBuilder

    • validateInputs

      protected void validateInputs() throws IllegalArgumentException
      Passes each input from the user through a series of checks. Iterates through editableTextFields to pass each item into the global validator checker, ErrorHandler. If user input is invalid, a flag is triggered and the checking continues. Afterwards, if any checks are flagged, method throws. Corresponding feedback for each text field is updated by ErrorHandler during the checks.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if inputs flagged as invalid
      See Also:
      • ErrorHandler.processInput(TextFieldContainer)
      • ErrorHandler.validateIntInputs(int, int, int, Text, Text, Text)
